DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine impact offer participate Practice Self-Regulation ( PS-R ) ( treatment ) relative offer participate Therapy Practice Group ( control ) increase knowledge sexual health impact trauma sexual decision-making prevent teen pregnancy high-risk behavior nine month end treatment .
DOC.detailed_description: The Policy & Research Group ( PRG ) evaluate Teen Pregnancy Prevention program , Practice Self-Regulation ( PSR ) . This intervention design address gaps exist evidence , reduce disparity teen pregnancy associate sexual reproductive health outcome , serve high-need population . The intervention compose ten structure , individual therapy session intend promote optimal sexual decision making . By increase knowledge sexual health impact trauma sexual decision-making , youth encourage support practice self-regulation . The primary focus study investigate impact intervention participant ' self-reported sexual behavior ( condom use number sexual partner ) . In addition , study include exploratory investigation follow theoretically relevant antecedent behavior pathway behavior change : ( 1 ) knowledge STIs safe sex practice ( include avoid unintended pregnancy ) ; ( 2 ) attitude beliefs toward safe sex practice ; ( 3 ) attitude beliefs regard emotion self-regulation ; ( 4 ) self-efficacy engage safe sex behavior ; ( 5 ) affect regulation self-efficacy ; ( 6 ) safe sex intention ; ( 7 ) safe sex commitment ; ( 8 ) self-regulatory intention ; ( 9 ) self-regulatory commitment ; ( 10 ) self-esteem ; ( 11 ) self-regulatory behavior tendency ; ( 12 ) emotional regulation behavior . The control ( counterfactual ) condition , Therapy Practice Group , consist therapy usual without incorporation element vital Practice Self-Regulation ( PSR ) intervention . All eligible individual provide proper consent participate randomize enrolled study time attend first schedule study session . Outcomes assess use self-reported , participant-level data gather ( way questionnaire ) three time point : baseline ( enrollment ) ; post-program ( immediately end intervention period ; 18 week baseline ) 9 month follow-up ( 9 month follow end intervention period ; 13 month baseline ) . The study take place New Mexico , Michigan , Maine 5 clinic serve youth age 14 19 impacted adverse childhood experience ( ACEs ) .
DOC.criteria: Between age 1419 Receive 3 high Adverse Childhood Experiences ( ACE ) Score Calculator Provide parental consent ( age 18 ) participant assent participate study Deemed appropriate study agency staff Receiving individual outpatient counseling service one study 's implementation sit Previous participation study Previous use Trauma Outcome Process ( TOP ) workbook therapy Selfreport previous participation TPPfunded program Selfreport roommate participate study
